reviewText: 116' long live gig in a packed theather presenting their -at the time- Love Is My Religion mega-hit. The stage is a bit smallish so it's a bit tight up there not allowing the band to move about much but the concert has a zippy pace without the need to rush the songs. The nice editing helps a lot in that respect, not too fast but not too stationary, snappy but not choppy with just seven cameras including a crane-mounted one.Pic is superb and pic ratio hovers around the respectable 6.5 Mbps mark, just perfect for the duration of the dvd.Sound is loud in 2.0 and packs a lot of bottom end, unfortunately without the punch I'm used to in most reggae dvds. I mean the kickdrum cuold have been louder because it gets drowned by the (many) B string fat notes thus blurring off the bottom end which I dare say is somewhat muddy. ZM's vox is gorgeous and pulls off being the loudest thing on the mix nicely but certainly at the expense of lower-in-the-mix guitars. The japanese guitarrist pulls off amazing soloing work but sounds too sedated. OK don't let my criticism ruin this release for you, this dvd is worth every penny and a must-have for any Marley fan.Extras include 2 great videoclips that round up 2 hours of music if paired with the gig and a backstage/interview feature. HIGHLY recommendable.

reviewText: I can shake off depression listening and dancing to this DVD.What a treat to have this DVD in my library.Upbeat and  Marley true to Marley - would you expect anything less?
summary: A Favorite In My DVD Library
Title: N/A

reviewText: Excellent dvd; the sound and video quality is fantastic. My only (small) complaint would be that "Black Cat" and "Beach in Hawaii" were not a part of it (two of the best songs off Ziggy's "Love is my Religion" album). A must have for any true reggae fan; Ziggy knows how to bring it, and the band is incredible too.
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Love Is My Religion Live" is nearly two hours of goodness. First off, the sound and picture quality are awesome. I own a lot of reggae dvds, many of which are of questionable quality. This dvd ranks among the best as far as technical quality. Second, I was amazed at how many songs Ziggy tears through in this concert. He covers many of his earlier hits, as well as plays a good many songs from his latest album. Additionally, he plays several Bob Marley songs. This concert is fairly long, which is a very good thing. Lastly, Ziggy and his band put a nice twist on many of the songs rather than just stick to the studio versions.This dvd is so good that it's ridiculous. Reggae fans, Ziggy fans, and Bob Marley fans should all check this concert out. It is truly one of the best concert dvds around. Jah bless!
